member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor
member.summary: Provides a base class that represents a type that can be implemented in order to monitor changes to cache entries.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor is called from constructors in derived classes to initialize the base class.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor.CacheKeys
member.summary: Gets a collection of cache keys that are monitored for changes.
member.returns: A collection of cache keys.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor.LastModified
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the latest time (in UTC time) that the monitored cache entry was changed.
member.returns: The elapsed time.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryChangeMonitor.RegionName
member.summary: Gets the name of a region of the cache.
member.returns: The name of a region in the cache.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments
member.summary: Provides information about a cache entry that was removed from the cache.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments.#ctor(System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache,System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason,System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The instance from which was removed.
One of the enumeration values that indicate why was removed.
An instance of the cached entry that was removed.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments.CacheItem
member.summary: Gets an instance of a cache entry that was removed from the cache.
member.returns: An instance of the class that was removed from the cache.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments.RemovedReason
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates why a cache entry was removed.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that indicates why the entry was removed.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedArguments.Source
member.summary: Gets a reference to the source instance that originally contained the removed cache entry.
member.returns: A reference to the cache that originally contained the removed cache entry.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedCallback
member.summary: Defines a reference to a method that is called after a cache entry is removed from the cache.
member.param: The information about the cache entry that was removed from the cache.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason
member.summary: Specifies the reason why a cache entry was removed or an entry is about to be removed.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason.Removed
member.summary: A cache entry was removed by using the or method.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason.Expired
member.summary: A cache entry was removed because it expired. Expiration can be based on an absolute time or on a sliding expiration time.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason.Evicted
member.summary: A cache entry was removed to free memory in the cache. This occurs when a cache instance approaches cache-specific memory limits, or when a process or cache instance approaches computer-wide memory limits.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason.ChangeMonitorChanged
member.summary: A cache entry was removed because a related dependency (such as a file or another cache entry) triggered eviction of the cache entry.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason.CacheSpecificEviction
member.summary: A cache entry was evicted for as reason that is defined by a particular cache implementation.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments
member.summary: Provides information about a cache entry that will be removed from the cache.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.#ctor(System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache,System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryRemovedReason,System.String,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The instance from which the cache entry referenced by will be removed.
One of the enumeration values that indicate why the cache entry will be removed.
The key of the cache entry that will be removed.
The name of the region in the cache to remove the cache entry from. This parameter is optional. If cache regions are not defined, must be null.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.Key
member.summary: Gets the unique identifier for a cache entry that is about to be removed.
member.returns: The unique identifier for the cache entry.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.RegionName
member.summary: Gets the name of a region in the cache that contains a cache entry.
member.returns: The name of a region in the cache. If regions are not used, this value is null.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.RemovedReason
member.summary: Gets the reason that a cache entry is about to be removed from the cache.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that describes why a cache entry is being removed.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.Source
member.summary: Gets a reference to the instance that contains a cache entry that is about to be removed.
member.returns: A reference to the cache instance.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.UpdatedCacheItem
member.summary: Gets or sets the value of entry that is used to update the cache object.
member.returns: The cache entry to update in the cache object. The default is null.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateArguments.UpdatedCacheItemPolicy
member.summary: Gets or sets the cache eviction or expiration policy of the entry that is updated.
member.returns: The cache eviction or expiration policy of the cache item that was updated. The default is null.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheEntryUpdateCallback
member.summary: Defines a reference to a method that is invoked when a cache entry is about to be removed from the cache.
member.param: The information about the entry that is about to be removed from the cache.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem
member.summary: Represents an individual cache entry in the cache.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem.#ctor(System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance using the specified key of a cache entry.
member.param: A unique identifier for a entry.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem.#ctor(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance using the specified key and a value of the cache entry.
member.param: A unique identifier for a entry.
The data for a entry.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem.#ctor(System.String,System.Object,System.String)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance using the specified key, value, and region of the cache entry.
member.param: A unique identifier for a entry.
The data for a entry.
The name of a region in the cache that will contain the entry.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem.Key
member.summary: Gets or sets a unique identifier for a instance.
member.returns: The identifier for a instance.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem.RegionName
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a region in the cache that contains a entry.
member.returns: The name of a region in a cache. The default is null.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem.Value
member.summary: Gets or sets the data for a instance.
member.returns: The data for a instance. The default is null.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy
member.summary: Represents a set of eviction and expiration details for a specific cache entry.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.AbsoluteExpiration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a cache entry should be evicted after a specified duration.
member.returns: The period of time that must pass before a cache entry is evicted. The default value is , meaning that the entry does not expire.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.ChangeMonitors
member.summary: Gets a collection of objects that are associated with a cache entry.
member.returns: A collection of change monitors. The default is an empty collection.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.Priority
member.summary: Gets or sets a priority setting that is used to determine whether to evict a cache entry.
member.returns: One of the enumeration values that indicates the priority for eviction. The default priority value is , which means no priority.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.RemovedCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to a delegate that is called after an entry is removed from the cache.
member.returns: A reference to a delegate that is called by a cache implementation.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.SlidingExpiration
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates whether a cache entry should be evicted if it has not been accessed in a given span of time.
member.returns: A span of time within which a cache entry must be accessed before the cache entry is evicted from the cache. The default is , meaning that the item should not be expired based on a time span.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy.UpdateCallback
member.summary: Gets or sets a reference to a delegate that is called before a cache entry is removed from the cache.
member.returns: A reference to a delegate that is called by a cache implementation.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPriority
member.summary: Specifies a priority setting that is used to decide whether to evict a cache entry.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPriority.Default
member.summary: Indicates that there is no priority for removing the cache entry.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPriority.NotRemovable
member.summary: Indicates that a cache entry should never be removed from the cache.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor
member.summary: Provides a base class for a derived custom type that monitors changes in the state of the data which a cache item depends on.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor is called from constructors in derived classes to initialize the base class.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor.Dispose
member.summary: Releases all resources that are used by the current instance of the class.
member.exception: Initialization is not complete in the derived change-monitor class that called the base method.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor.Dispose(System.Boolean)
member.summary: Releases all managed and unmanaged resources and any references to the instance. This overload must be implemented by derived change-monitor classes.
member.param: true to release managed and unmanaged resources and any references to a instance; false to release only unmanaged resources. When false is passed, the method is called by a finalizer thread and any external managed references are likely no longer valid because they have already been garbage collected.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor.HasChanged
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates that the state that is monitored by the class has changed.
member.returns: true if the state that is monitored by the instance has changed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor.InitializationComplete
member.summary: Called from the constructor of derived classes to indicate that initialization is finished.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor.IsDisposed
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates that the derived instance of a class is disposed.
member.returns: true if the instance is disposed; otherwise, false.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor.NotifyOnChanged(System.Runtime.Caching.OnChangedCallback)
member.summary: Called by Cache implementers to register a callback and notify an instance through the delegate when a dependency has changed.
member.param: A reference to a method that is invoked when a dependency has changed.
member.exception: The callback method has already been invoked.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor.OnChanged(System.Object)
member.summary: Called by derived classes to raise the event when a dependency changes.
member.param: The data for the change event. This value can be null.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.ChangeMonitor.UniqueId
member.summary: Gets a value that represents the class instance.
member.returns: The identifier for a change-monitor instance.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities
member.summary: Represents a set of features that a cache implementation provides.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.None
member.summary: A cache implementation does not provide any of the features that are described in the enumeration.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.InMemoryProvider
member.summary: A cache implementation runs at least partially in memory. A distributed cache would not set this flag, whereas an in-memory cache such as the class would do so.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.OutOfProcessProvider
member.summary: A cache implementation runs out-of-process. A distributed cache would set this flag, whereas an in-memory cache such as the class would not.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.CacheEntryChangeMonitors
member.summary: A cache implementation supports the ability to create change monitors that monitor entries.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.AbsoluteExpirations
member.summary: A cache implementation supports the ability to automatically remove cache entries at a specific date and time.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.SlidingExpirations
member.summary: A cache implementation supports the ability to automatically remove cache entries that have not been accessed in a specified time span.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.CacheEntryUpdateCallback
member.summary: A cache implementation can raise a notification that an entry is about to be removed from the cache. This setting also indicates that a cache implementation supports the ability to automatically replace the entry that is being removed with a new cache entry.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.CacheEntryRemovedCallback
member.summary: A cache implementation can raise a notification that an entry has been removed from the cache.

member.name: F:System.Runtime.Caching.DefaultCacheCapabilities.CacheRegions
member.summary: A cache implementation supports the ability to partition its storage into cache regions, and supports the ability to insert cache entries into those regions and to retrieve cache entries from those regions.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.FileChangeMonitor
member.summary: Represents an object that monitors changes to files.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.FileChangeMonitor.#ctor
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class. This constructor is called from constructors in derived classes in order to initialize the base class.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.FileChangeMonitor.FilePaths
member.summary: Gets a collection that contains the paths of files that are monitored for changes.
member.returns: A collection of file paths.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.FileChangeMonitor.LastModified
member.summary: Gets a value that indicates the last time that a file that is being monitored was changed.
member.returns: If multiple files are monitored, the last modified time of the most recently modified file; otherwise, the last time that the file that is being monitored was changed.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.HostFileChangeMonitor
member.summary: Monitors directories and file paths and notifies the cache of changes to the monitored items. This class cannot be inherited.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.HostFileChangeMonitor.#ctor(System.Collections.Generic.IList{System.String})
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: A list that contains one or more directory paths or file paths to monitor.
member.exception: contains zero items. -or-A path in the list is null or an empty string.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.HostFileChangeMonitor.FilePaths
member.summary: Gets the collection of directories and file paths that was passed to the constructor.
member.returns: A collection of directories and file paths.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.HostFileChangeMonitor.LastModified
member.summary: Gets a read-only value that indicates the last write time of a monitored file or path.
member.returns: The last write time of a monitored file or path.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.HostFileChangeMonitor.UniqueId
member.summary: Gets an identifier for the instance that is based on the set of monitored directories and file paths.
member.returns: An identifier for the change monitor.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.MemoryCache
member.summary: Represents the type that implements an in-memory cache.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.MemoryCache.#ctor(System.String,System.Collections.Specialized.NameValueCollection)
member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.
member.param: The name to use to look up configuration information. Note It is not required for configuration information to exist for every name.If a matching configuration entry exists, the configuration information is used to configure the instance. If a matching configuration entry does not exist, the name can be accessed through the property, because the specified name is associated with the instance. For information about memory cache configuration, see .
A collection of name/value pairs of configuration information to use for configuring the cache.
member.exception: The string value "default" (case insensitive) is assigned to . The value "default" cannot be assigned to a new instance, because the value is reserved for use by the property.
A value in the collection is invalid.
A name or value in the parameter could not be parsed.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.MemoryCache.Add(System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem,System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy)
member.summary: Inserts a cache entry into the cache as a instance, and adds details about how the entry should be evicted.
member.returns: true if insertion succeeded, or false if there is an already an entry in the cache that has the same key as item.
member.param: The object to add.
An object that contains eviction details for the cache entry. This object provides more options for eviction than a simple absolute expiration.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.MemoryCache.AddOrGetExisting(System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem,System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy)
member.summary: Adds a cache entry into the cache using the specified instance and details about how to evict the entry.
member.returns: If a cache entry with the same key exists, the existing cache entry; otherwise, null.
member.param: The object to add.
An object that contains eviction details for the cache entry. This object provides more options for eviction than a simple absolute expiration.
member.exception: An property has been supplied. NoteThe and method overloads do not support the property. Therefore, to set the property for a cache entry, use the method overloads instead.

Both the absolute and sliding expiration values for the object are set to values other than the defaults of and fields. The class cannot set expiration policy based on a combination of an absolute expiration and a sliding expiration. Only one expiration setting can be explicitly set when you use the instance. The other expiration setting must be set to field or field.
The property is set to a value less than . -or-The property is set to a value greater than one year.-or-The property is not a value of the enumeration.

member.returns: If a cache entry with the same key exists, the existing cache entry; otherwise, null.
member.param: A unique identifier for the cache entry to add.
The data for the cache entry.
The fixed date and time at which the cache entry will expire.
A named region in the cache to which a cache entry can be added. Do not pass a value for this parameter. This parameter is null by default, because the class does not implement regions.
member.exception: An property has been supplied. NoteThe and the method overloads do not support the property. Therefore, to set the property for a cache entry, use the overloads instead.

Both the absolute and sliding expiration values for the object are set to values other than the defaults of and fields. member.summary: Inserts a cache entry into the cache using the specified key and value and the specified details for how it is to be evicted.
member.returns: If a matching cache entry already exists, a cache entry; otherwise, null.

The other setting must be set to or .-or-Both the removal callback and the update callback have been specified for . The only supports using one type of callback per cache entry.
The property is set to a value less than .-or-The has been set to a value greater than one year.-or-The property is not a value of the enumeration.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.MemoryCache.Set(System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem,System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy)
member.summary: Inserts a cache entry into the cache by using a instance to supply the key and value for the cache entry.
member.param: An object that represents a cache entry to insert.
An object that contains eviction details for the cache entry. This object provides more options for eviction than a simple absolute expiration.
member.exception: is null.-or-The property is null.-or-The property is null.

An invalid combination of arguments for the cache entry was passed. This occurs if the following expiration details are set on the policy object for the cache entry:If both the absolute and sliding expiration values of the object are set to values other than the defaults of and fields. The class cannot set expiration policy based on both an absolute expiration and a sliding expiration. Only one expiration setting can be explicitly set when you use the class. The other setting must be set to or property. If both the removal callback and the update callback are specified for object. The class only supports using one type of callback per cache entry.
The property is set to a value less than . -or-The property is set to a value greater than one year.-or-The is not a value of the enumeration.

The data for the cache entry.
An object that contains eviction details for the cache entry. This object provides more options for eviction than a simple absolute expiration.

An invalid combination of arguments for the cache entry exists. This occurs if the following expiration details are set on the policy object for the cache entry:If both the absolute and sliding expiration values on object are set to values other than the defaults of and . This is because the class does not support expiring entries based on both an absolute and a sliding expiration. Only one expiration setting can be explicitly set when you use the class. The other setting must be set to or . If both the removal callback and the update callback are specified on class. The class only supports using one type of callback per cache entry.
The property is set to a value less than . -or-The property is set to a value greater than one year.-or-The property is not a value of the enumeration.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.MemoryCache.Trim(System.Int32)
member.summary: Removes a specified percentage of cache entries from the cache object.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache
member.summary: Represents an object cache and provides the base methods and properties for accessing the object cache.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache.#ctor
member.summary: Called from constructors in derived classes in order to initialize the class.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache.Add(System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem,System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, tries to insert a cache entry into the cache as a instance, and adds details about how the entry should be evicted.
member.returns: true if insertion succeeded, or false if there is an already an entry in the cache that has the same key as .
member.param: The object to add.
An object that contains eviction details for the cache entry. This object provides more options for eviction than a simple absolute expiration.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.DateTimeOffset,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, inserts a cache entry into the cache without overwriting any existing cache entry.
member.returns: true if insertion succeeded, or false if there is an already an entry in the cache that has the same key as .
member.param: A unique identifier for the cache entry.
The object to insert.
The fixed date and time at which the cache entry will expire. This parameter is required when the method is called.
Optional. A named region in the cache to which the cache entry can be added, if regions are implemented. Because regions are not implemented in .NET Framework 4, the default value is null.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache.Add(System.String,System.Object,System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy,System.String)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, inserts a cache entry into the cache, specifying information about how the entry will be evicted.
member.returns: true if the insertion try succeeds, or false if there is an already an entry in the cache with the same key as .
member.param: A unique identifier for the cache entry.
The object to insert.
An object that contains eviction details for the cache entry. This object provides more options for eviction than a simple absolute expiration.
Optional. A named region in the cache to which the cache entry can be added, if regions are implemented. The default value for the optional parameter is null.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.ObjectCache.AddOrGetExisting(System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItem,System.Runtime.Caching.CacheItemPolicy)
member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, inserts the specified object into the cache, specifying information about how the entry will be evicted.
member.returns: If a cache entry with the same key exists, the specified cache entry; otherwise, null.
member.param: The object to insert.
An object that contains eviction details for the cache entry. This object provides more options for eviction than a simple absolute expiration.

member.summary: When overridden in a derived class, inserts a cache entry into the cache, by using a key, an object for the cache entry, an absolute expiration value, and an optional region to add the cache into.
member.returns: If a cache entry with the same key exists, the specified cache entry's value; otherwise, null.
member.param: A unique identifier for the cache entry.
The object to insert.
The fixed date and time at which the cache entry will expire.
Optional. A named region in the cache to which the cache entry can be added, if regions are implemented. The default value for the optional parameter is null.

An object that contains eviction details for the cache entry. This object provides more options for eviction than a simple absolute expiration.

member.summary: Initializes a new instance of the class.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.Configuration.MemoryCacheElement.CacheMemoryLimitMegabytes
member.summary: Gets or sets the maximum memory size, in megabytes, that an instance of a object can grow to.
member.returns: The amount of maximum memory size, in megabytes. The default is zero, which indicates that instances manage their own memory based on the amount of memory that is installed on the computer.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.Configuration.MemoryCacheElement.Name
member.summary: Gets or sets the name of a particular cache configuration.
member.returns: The name of a cache configuration.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.Configuration.MemoryCacheElement.PhysicalMemoryLimitPercentage
member.summary: Gets or sets the percentage of server memory that can be used by the cache.
member.returns: The percentage of physical memory that the cache can use, expressed as an integer value from 1 to 100. The default is zero, which indicates that instances manage their own memory based on the amount of memory that is installed on the computer.

member.name: P:System.Runtime.Caching.Configuration.MemoryCacheElement.PollingInterval
member.summary: Gets or sets a value that indicates the time interval after which the cache implementation compares the current memory load against the absolute and percentage-based memory limits that are set for the cache instance.
member.returns: The time interval after which the cache implementation compares the current memory load against the absolute and percentage-based memory limits that are set for the cache instance. The default is two minutes.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.Hosting.IFileChangeNotificationSystem
member.summary: Defines a way to expose a custom object to a cache implementation.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.Hosting.IFileChangeNotificationSystem.StartMonitoring(System.String,System.Runtime.Caching.OnChangedCallback,System.Object@,System.DateTimeOffset@,System.Int64@)
member.summary: Registers a file path to monitor with the host environment.
member.param: The fully qualified physical path of a directory or file to monitor for changes.
A reference to a method that implements the delegate. When the monitored file or directory changes, the host environment's implementation of the interface raises an event by calling the class.

The state that is supplied by the host environment. Cache implementations and custom change monitors should treat the state value as opaque. However, the state must be stored so that it can be sent to the host environment when the cache implementation calls the method.
When this method returns, contains the last date and time that a write operation occurred on . This parameter is passed uninitialized. This parameter is returned from the host environment.
When this method returns, contains the total size of the monitored . This parameter is passed uninitialized. This parameter is returned from the host environment.

member.name: M:System.Runtime.Caching.Hosting.IFileChangeNotificationSystem.StopMonitoring(System.String,System.Object)
member.summary: Ends change monitoring.
member.param: The path of the file or folder to stop monitoring. This should match a file path value that was passed in an earlier call to the method.
The state information that was originally supplied by the host environment during an earlier call to the method.

member.name: T:System.Runtime.Caching.Hosting.IMemoryCacheManager
member.summary: Defines an interface that a cache uses in order to communicate cache memory usage to a host environment.

member.summary: Removes all references to a cache in the host environment.
member.param: A reference to the cache.

member.summary: Reports the size of the current cache.
member.param: The size of the memory, in bytes, that the cache consumes.
A reference to the cache.
